plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Sunflowers are tall annual plants with large, bright yellow composite flower heads that track the sun. They are widely cultivated and also found in the wild, thriving in temperate regions.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism in bud stage, turning to follow the sun throughout the day.

plants.name: Hydrangea macrophylla
plants.description: This deciduous shrub is prized for its large, globe-shaped flower clusters, which can change color depending on soil pH.
plants.location: East Asia and widely cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Hydrangea flower color is influenced by aluminum availability, which is governed by soil acidity.

plants.name: Lilium lancifolium
plants.description: A hardy perennial with striking orange flowers marked with dark spots, often growing wild and cultivated in temperate and subtropical regions.
plants.location: East Asia, also naturalized in parts of North America
plants.funFact: Tiger lilies produce bulbils in leaf axils, allowing propagation without seeds.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An Australian native tree known for its bright orange, spider-like flowers that attract birds and insects.
plants.location: Eastern Australia and widely cultivated in subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is not an oak but belongs to the Proteaceae family.
